attributes.action: Make pre-election manifesto promises binding in law.
attributes.additional_details: Governments are meant to be accountable to the people for their pre-election promises & actions but are currently immune from any sanction between General Elections if these promises & actions are not fulfilled or are deliberately shelved once they gain a majority in the House.
attributes.background: Voters must be able to rely on honest pre-election dialogue in order to be confident that if they vote for a candidate based on Party manifesto promises these must be legally binding if the incoming Government achieves an absolute majority.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Make breaking a manifesto against the law and trigger a General Election
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/700035
